results.title: Mountain People
results.brief_description: Contrasts lifestyles of the Swiss people of Guarda and the Gurungs of Nepal. Looks at the way in which people isolated by mountains retain their cultures and way of life. No other credits available.
results.description: Contrasts lifestyles of the Swiss people of Guarda and the Gurungs of Nepal. Looks at the way in which people isolated by mountains retain their cultures and way of life. No other credits available.

results.title: Mountain music
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton Productions and Will Vinton
results.brief_description: A 3-D animated film portraying the impact of modern technology on the planet. The happy and tranquil life of forest creatures is changed by three musicians whose amplified sounds, cause the eruption of a mountain. Animated by Bevan Vinton, Bob Gardiner and Will Vinton. Featuring Kath Hendrickson. Music by Bill Scream and Paul Jameson.

results.title: Mountain man
results.creator_credit: Ford Film Unit and Terry Ohlsson
results.brief_description: The 1964 Monte Carlo rally seen through the eyes of champion rally driver Vic Elford. With his partner David Stopne, driving a Cortina, Elford emerged from hazards of dust and fog, blinding sunlight and driving rain as winner of the touring category, with a class victory and a coveted Coupes des Alpes.

results.title: Mountain lands in jeopardy
results.brief_description: The soil erosion caused by introduced animals in the mountains of New Zealand. The vegetation in the alpine country around the head-waters of the Waitake River has been destoryed by deer, hare and thar. Burning off the natural tussock to create sheep pasture has added to the problem. Erosion and flooding of valley farms has resulted.

results.title: Mountain family in Europe
results.brief_description: Passing through a mountain valley to a small village, the camera follows a tractor up the hillsides to the summer grazing area. Here the summer activities are seen: the milking of cows by hand, the making of cheese and the cutting, drying and collection of hay. No commentary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Mount Lofty Ranges: a total picture
results.brief_description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. It asks the question “Can we cater for the changing land - use demands and still maintain a balanced environment?”
results.description: Investigates how life in this delicate ecological system affects all South Australians and the conservation and development options now necessary to protect our environmentally threatened Ranges. results.title: Mount Isa copper
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the copper industry based at Mt Isa in Queensland. Introduces typical workers and a housewife living in the town of 14,000 people. Shows completion of refining at Stuart near Townsville of pure copper suited to electrical use. Commentary by Shan Benson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Eric Thompson and Antonio Colacino

results.title: Mount Gambier
results.brief_description: A typical Australian family living in Mount Gambier, south Australia. Shows rural agricultural and manufacturing industry of the area and features the recreational pastimes of members of the family.

results.title: Mount Buffalo National Park
results.brief_description: A summer-time study of one of Victoria’s most popular holiday resorts. Mount Buffalo provides facilities for snow sports in winter, and is ideal for hiking, fishing, climbing and cross-country walking in summer. Commentary by Terry Dear, photography by Roy Driver.
results.description: A summer-time study of one of Victoria’s most popular holiday resorts. Mount Buffalo provides facilities for snow sports in winter, and is ideal for hiking, fishing, climbing and cross-country walking in summer. Commentary by Terry Dear, photography by Roy Driver.

results.title: Moulin Rouge
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Martin Brown, Baz Luhrmann and Fred Baron
results.brief_description: The third instalment in Baz Luhrmann’s ‘Red curtain’ trilogy (made up of “Strictly Ballroom” and “Romeo and Juliet”), “Moulin Rouge” is a kinetic and gaudy paean to the infamous Paris nightclub. Borrowing its cues from just about every pop song written in the last century from Marc Bolan to Kurt Cobain, this ferociously paced musical tells the tragi-comic tale of doomed lovers Satine (Nicole Kidman) and Christian (Ewan McGregor). Apart from the countless Hollywood musicals it borrows from, “Moulin Rouge” ultimately takes it’s inspiration from the classic Orpheus and Eurydice tale, substituting 1900’s Paris for the underworld that Orpheus descends into in order to rescue his true love. Kidman’s Satine (played as a larger than life Marilyn Monroe), is the collectively worshiped dance hall queen of the Moulin Rouge who falls for the hapless poet, Christian. McGregor brings genuine feeling to his role as the innocent dreamer who learns the hard way of the darkness lurking behind the seductive glamour of the Paris night scene. Luhrmann has much fun with this decorative folly, not stopping for a breath as he moves from one outlandish set to another. Everything is pitched at the most broadest level from the performances (Richard Roxburgh is beyond camp as the slippery Duke of Monroth), to the manic camera work which zooms from the smallest detail to the highest roof top in a single leap. Cast includes Jim Broadbent, Richard Roxburgh, John Leguizamo, Garry McDonald, Christine Anu, Kylie Minogue, David Wenham and Kerry Walker.
